page.title: 18Tuffley's Churches.
page.content: The Tuffley area is served by three Anglican Churches (St. George, Grange Road _ St. Michael, First Avenue _ St. Barnabas, Stroud Road), one Baptist church in Grange Road and one Roman Catholic church in Tuffley Lane. None of the buildings is over 50 years old because they were built as Tuffley was developed from a hamlet. The most recent one (Catholic) was opened in 1984, being used at present for Sunday services only. The steeply pitched concrete portal frame building of St. George was constructed in 1956 and the adjoining church centre in 1971. A striking and unique feature inside the church is the "Last Supper" reredos.
